summary: Ann Lyon Strickland was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Payroll records and certifications from late 1976 through 1978 document her employment, including her salary and pay periods. These documents include payroll authorization forms and leave records. Her involvement with the HSCA is further evidenced by her inclusion in background checks, as indicated by correspondence and fingerprint analysis reports. The documents suggest she was a staff member during a significant period of the HSCA's investigation.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Ann Lyon Strickland's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, contributing to the investigation into the JFK assassination. The payroll and background check documents confirm her employment and involvement in the committee's work.
